meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive John Wilkins Sallie Rawlston Aarin Martinez Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6662.

td.p: John Wilkins, an 11-year-old sixth grader from Chevy Chase, Maryland
Sallie Rawlston, a 10-year-old fifth grader from Soddy-Daisy, Tennessee
Aarin Martinez, a 12-year-old seventh grader from Torrance, California

tr.td: BOOK TALK
OLYMPIC SPORTS OBJECTS
CLOTHING
WORLD FACTS
U.S. STAMPS
GIVE UP THE "SHIP"!

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_6_5', 'clue_DJ_6_5_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows us the clue in the lab with a balloon covering the neck of a bottle.) There\'s more than one way to blow up a balloon. When baking soda inside the balloon is released into a bottle of vinegar, it causes a bubbly chemical reaction and creates this gas that then inflates the balloon.')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows us the clue in the lab with a balloon covering the neck of a bottle.) There's more than one way to blow up a balloon. When baking soda inside the balloon is released into a bottle of vinegar, it causes a bubbly chemical reaction and creates this gas that then inflates the balloon.

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
